title: Hun Hunshi Hunshilal
text:
Hun Hunshi Hunshilal (; English Title: "Love in the Time of Malaria") is a 1992 Indian <a href="Gujarati%20language">Gujarati-language</a> <a href="musical%20film">musical</a> <a href="political%20satire">political satire</a> film directed by Sanjiv Shah.
Plot.
In the kingdom of Khojpuri, King Bhadrabhoop II (<a href="Mohan%20Gokhale">Mohan Gokhale</a>), is annoyed by mosquitoes (representative of middle and lower class).
In a small village, Doongri, Hunshi is born to a doctor. After growing up, he adopts more respectable moniker, Hunshilal (<a href="Dilip%20Joshi">Dilip Joshi</a>). Hunshilal moves to Khojpuri to work at Queen's Lab, a laboratory which aims to eradicate mosquitoes problem once and for all. At the lab, Hunshilal falls in love with the fellow scientist, Parveen (<a href="Renuka%20Shahane">Renuka Shahane</a>).
Soundtrack.
The film had 45 songs. The composer <a href="Rajat%20Dholakia">Rajat Dholakia</a> composed them in two days.
